title: Creative Industry Displacement by 2030
description: Projected percentage of creative roles (design, writing, marketing) significantly restructured or eliminated by generative AI by 2030. Only data points where sources directly state a displacement figure are plotted.

overlays.label: McKinsey: 25-40% of creative task time automatable
BLS: graphic designer jobs to decline 4%
Queen Mary/Turing: 73% of freelancers report reduced job security
JEBO (peer-reviewed): writing postings -30%, graphic design -18% within 8 months of ChatGPT
Society of Authors UK: 26% of illustrators, 36% of translators already lost work to AI
CAIS/Scale AI: AI succeeds at audio/image/logo tasks but fails most creative projects (2.5% overall)
Dallas Fed: CS design wages up 16.7% vs 7.5% national; AI augments experienced workers

sources.title: Future of Jobs Report 2023 — Creative and Media Professions
sources.excerpt: Graphic designers, copywriters, and marketing analysts are among the roles employers expect to decline most rapidly due to generative AI.

sources.title: The economic potential of generative AI — Creative work
sources.excerpt: Generative AI could automate 25-40% of time spent on creative tasks, fundamentally changing the economics of content production.

sources.title: Upwork Q2 2024 Earnings — Freelancer Market Trends
sources.excerpt: Writing and translation freelancer job volume declined ~30% YoY. Graphic design jobs fell 17%. AI-augmented creative roles grew 45%.

sources.title: Generative AI and Creative Work: Evidence from Freelance Platforms
sources.excerpt: Image generation AI reduced demand for freelance illustrators by 21% within 12 months of widespread availability.

sources.title: As layoffs deepen, AI's role in the cuts is murky — but it definitely has one
sources.excerpt: The advent and uptake of AI is playing some part in the scope of tech layoffs. Companies have signaled sizeable investments in AI to augment or replace work currently done by people.

sources.title: The Impact of Generative AI on Marketing and Creative Roles
sources.excerpt: By 2028, 20% of marketing content will be generated entirely by AI. Creative teams will shrink 15-25% but output will increase.

sources.title: Occupational Outlook: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media
sources.excerpt: Graphic designer employment projected to decline 4% through 2033. Technical writers projected flat. New AI-creative hybrid roles growing.

sources.title: Fiverr Announces Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Results
sources.excerpt: Fiverr FY2024 marketplace revenue declined 1.3% YoY to $303.1M. Active buyers fell 10% to 3.6M. AI-related categories showed strong growth while traditional low-complexity gig categories contracted.

sources.title: AI Can Automate Creative Professions, UOC Study Finds
sources.excerpt: Peer-reviewed study finds AI can now automate substantial portions of creative work. Freelance writing gigs dropped 30% post-ChatGPT launch.

sources.title: Creative Economy Outlook 2024
sources.excerpt: Covers the role of creative industries in trade and economic growth; discusses AI's impact on the creative economy. Creative services exports surged to $1.4 trillion in 2022.

sources.title: New Frontiers: The Origins and Content of New Work, 1940–2018
sources.excerpt: Demand-eroding effects of automation innovations have intensified in past four decades. New work creation has shifted from production to high-paid professional occupations.

sources.title: AI Labor Market Impact: Freelancers
sources.excerpt: Heaviest pre-ChatGPT freelance spenders shifted to AI tools fastest; substitution ratio of $1 reduced freelance spend to only $0.03 in AI spend.

sources.title: Is Generative AI a Job Killer? Evidence from the Freelance Market
sources.excerpt: Significant decline in job availability and earnings for freelancers in AI-affected creative occupations; some workers adapted by transitioning to programming.

sources.title: Indeed Hiring Lab: Creative & Design Job Postings Tracker
sources.excerpt: Computer graphic artist job postings declined 33% from pre-ChatGPT levels. Illustration and copywriting postings down 40%+. AI-creative hybrid roles growing.

sources.title: Creative Industries and GenAI (CREAATIF Good Work Report)
sources.publisher: Queen Mary University of London / Alan Turing Institute
sources.excerpt: Survey of 335 freelance creative workers: 73% believe GenAI is altering quality of work; 68% feel job security reduced; 61% say value placed on their work has decreased; 55% report decline in financial compensation.

sources.title: Winners and Losers of Generative AI: Early Evidence of Shifts in Freelancer Demand
sources.publisher: Journal of Economic Behavior & Organization (Demirci, Jiang, Kartal, Trujillo)
sources.excerpt: Peer-reviewed analysis of 2M job postings: freelance writing postings fell 30.37%, graphic design 18.49%, 3D modeling 15.57% within 8 months of ChatGPT launch. Applications per posting rose 8.57%.

sources.title: Society of Authors UK Survey: Impact of Generative AI on Creative Workers
sources.excerpt: 26% of illustrators and 36% of translators have already lost work to generative AI. 78% of illustrators and 77% of translators expect further income decline. Survey of 787 creative professionals.

sources.title: Remote Labor Index: Measuring AI Automation of Remote Work
sources.publisher: Center for AI Safety / Scale AI (Mazeika et al.)
sources.excerpt: Successful AI automations were concentrated in specific creative domains, particularly audio tasks (sound effects, vocal separation), image generation (logos, ads), report writing, and data retrieval. Overall automation rate only 2.5%.

sources.title: AI is simultaneously aiding and replacing workers, wage data suggest
sources.publisher: Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas (J. Scott Davis)
sources.excerpt: nominal average weekly wages nationwide have increased 7.5 percent, while the computer systems design sector has risen 16.7 percent
